column2: Cubism.js: A JavaScript library for time series visualization.

column5:
Merge pull request #141 from square/tristans/fix-vulns

fix vulns from outdated package.json
rebuild cubism with new librato adapter; v1.6.0
No, really really really really fix links.
bumping version for ganglia support, closes #22

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/reznor/cubism into reznor-master

* 'master' of https://github.com/reznor/cubism:
  Add support for Ganglia metrics (by means of GangliaWeb).
be nice to FF 3.6 and catch undefined y (thanks @godsflaw)
No, really, fix the wiki link.

Merge pull request #42 from num1/patch-1

Fix broken link to wiki in README.md
Fix broken link to wiki in README.md
Made change in graphite.js rather than compiled file

Context step is defined in milliseconds. Graphite summarize function needs to divide by 1000 to get the step in seconds. Without this fix, currently passes the summarize function in milliseconds breaking graph rendering
When `i` is null, don't set the left position.
Fix half-pixel coordinate when margin: auto.

Default graphite.summarize; metrics for rules.

Graphite metrics now default to using summarize with the method "sum", so that
even if you forget to apply a summarize, you get reasonable default behavior.
This commit also adds metric supports for the rule primitive, so that you can
display event markers (e.g., deploys) on top of other charts.

Add summarize method for graphite metrics.

This makes it easier to implement summarize correctly for Graphite metrics: the
metric can use the associated context's step interval to determine the
appropriate interval string for Graphite's summarize function.
Use day format for longer time steps.

Fix a bug with missing data on first axis tick.

By using select, we were inadvertantly overwriting the data of the first tick.

Comparison chart improvements.

Use slightly darker colors for the primary metric for greater contrast. Observe
the minimum value of the extent. Consistent overplotting.
On second thought, don't duplicate Wiki content.

Add the ability to dispose of contexts & charts.

You can now stop a context by calling stop. You can also remove an associated
horizon chart by calling horizon.remove on a given selection. Similar methods
are available for the other chart components.
Fix a bug with synchronous metrics.

Expose context.metric.

You can now write your own metric implementations. Hooray!
Display the focused time in the axis.
Fix a bug with negative domains.

Fix a positioning bug with rule.

Also, bump version to 0.1.0.

Fix race conditions and order dependence.

Metrics are now stored in a single array, rather than creating a temporary copy.
In addition, we make sure that new values are written to the correct place, even
if multiple context change events are received while requests are in-flight.

Metrics now listen to a "beforechange" event which occurs immediately before the
"change" event, allowing the metrics to update their stored values (shifting, if
necessary) before any charts attempt to display them. New values are appended to
the end of the array on a successful "prepare" event, thus avoiding any conflict
or temporary missing data. This also means that the first metric change event
reports times that are consistent with change, rather than with prepare.

Fix bug in double-buffered update.

The horizon chart gets notified by both the metric and the context, so we must
distinguish between the two when shifting previously-drawn pixels.

Fix another potential race condition on change.

If the valuesNext start time doesn't match the change start time, we must shift
the values to match the display.
Prevent scroll when left & right focuses.
Add keyboard shortcuts for left & right.

Swap to new array on context change.

This guarantees that the metric is consistent with the context. Previously, the
metric was inconsistent after a successful request (from beforechange) and the
next change event.

Avoid race condition using temporary array.

Previously, we'd be missing values between the beforechange event and subsequent
change event. Also, using a temporary array is safer for concurrent requests.
Don't assume mousemove to position rule.
Add cubism.option for parsing query parameters.

Update start0 immediately.

Otherwise, if we have failed requests, we won't update the window correctly.
There appears to be a related bug with concurrent requests; I'll fix that later.

Increase the default delays.

A longer client delay is needed when many metrics are fetched simultaneously.

Faster initialization.

The previous code made a few assumptions about when metrics were created. Now
the context notifies beforechange and change listeners of the current time
window immediately, so they can make requests as soon as they are bound.

Change default heights.

The horizon chart default height is now 30px. To match aspect ratios, the
default comparison chart height is now 120px.
Add method for finding Graphite metrics.
Expose the context's scale and axis.
Default to colors for light background.
The off-by-one has been fixed, yay.

Fix a bug with listener name collisions.

If a given chart is listening to the same metric multiple times (such as when
displaying metric 0, and also the difference between metric 0 and metric 1),
then we must make sure the chart uses unique names for each listener.
Fix a bug detecting when metrics are ready.
Don't include the comparison metric in the extent.

Fix a bug where metrics would not auto-update.

Since we changed the metrics to only update if someone is listening, someone
needs to listen or the metrics will not update! However, the charts don't need
to redraw on metric change, since we want the charts to update concurrently on
context change. Now we use a dummy listener to force metrics to update.
Fix a bug when beforechange fired repeatedly.
Only fetch metrics if listeners are listening.
Pretty sure there's an off-by-one here.
There's an off-by-one (or two) here somewhere.
Display metrics as soon as they are available.

Cleaner metric composition using method chaining.

Also, change the implementation of time shifting to correctly handle daylight
savings time, where there can be discontinuities.
